Fun cool fact: They can jump as high as most humans.

As stated in the video "they can jump as high as your knees" which is actually around how high humans can jump. In fact, that's how high a majority of species can jump. It has something to do with the ratio of body mass and muscle strength being pretty consistent across species.

They're called Sand Fleas for more than just their acrobatics, don't go camping right on the beach 😂

"Without these hungry acrobats, beaches the world over would be strewn with rotting seaweed."

These guys are apparently in the middle of a hunger strike every time I go to the beach.
Now I know what their real name. I always wonder what are this creature when I was a kid.

Wait, then what are the tiny “bugs” by the shore in the evening that bite ankles? They hurt, and I thought THEY were sand fleas!

I met them in Southern Georgia — they didn’t bite if I walked INTO the water!

These are one of the worst things at the beach, get one in your ear and their jumps are kicks against your ear drum that are worse than any bites! The best solution is to pour a freshly opened carbonated drink in your ear and hope that it's movement will cause the sand flea to become surrounded in bubbles and float up to the surface and out of your ear before it drowns in there. water might also work but FRESH bear and soda are the best options! hope this helps someone.
